授業目的: This course is an introduction to various issues related to contemporary Japanese society, where we consider “contemporary Japan” as a “post-WWII Japan.” The course is designed to discuss demographic/structural patterns of Japanese society, such as class, gender, ethnic stratification, as well as analyzes various special topics that explain Japanese society, such as working conditions, education, family, etc. Overall the course will provide you with tools for understanding Japan’s positioning in the World, help you in re-examining stereotypical ideas about Japan and understand better the culture and its people.
到達目標:
Knowledge. After studying this course, you will be able to:
- Demonstrate a basic understanding of different interpretations of Japanese culture and society; 
- Understand various social problems in Japan; 
- Understand the relationship between the demographic/structural patterns and social happenings; 
- Assess the impact of globalization on everyday life in Japan. 
Skills. After studying this course, you will be able to:
- Demonstrate the ability to work independently and in a self-directed manner through appropriate planning, time management, and completion of course work; 
- Demonstrate an ability to make a positive contribution to small group discussion and activities; 
- With a degree of confidence, begin to critically engage with source material in order to accurately summarize key themes/topics in a presentation format; 
- Synthesize a small number of readings to produce a summary reports.
